result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial on October 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:10 AM Defendant Jesse L Hansen Schumann in court, in custody.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Jesse L Hansen Schumann.  Attorney Nathan T Oswald in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Jakobson states that speedy trial was filed on 22CF378 and is set for next week. Due to some issues with witness testimony, he is withdrawing his speedy trial demand and asks that trial be removed from calendar.
Court questions defendant regarding withdrawing speedy trial demand and he wishes to withdraw his request. 
Attorney Lambert makes statement regarding the witness. He thinks there is no new information and there is no new offer. He wants to proceed with trial next week unless defendant wants to accept the offer made.
Attorney Jakobson responds. 
Court grants adjournment and trial will be removed from calendar.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
re: defendant's employment
Text Message Reminder of Court Date Agreement
Can have incidental contact at work as long as they are in the facility. Parties can attend counseling together.  Parties can have telephone contact to arrange first appointment.

4:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Daniel McGrath in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesse L Hansen Schumann in court.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Jesse L Hansen Schumann. Victim MLK appears in court.
Court reviews the letter from the victim requesting a bond modification to change the no contact condition. 
Victim makes a statement to the court requesting the modification. Attorney McGrath states his concerns regarding the modification and his recommendation. Attorney Jakobson gives a statement regarding the modification.
Final pre-trial on October 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
7/25/22 Preliminary Hearing Notice
from alleged victim requesting no contact be removed from the bond
Hearing on no contact order on August 5, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

3:05 PM Defendant Jesse L Hansen Schumann in court.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Jesse L Hansen Schumann.  Attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cody Strey is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Oswald. He is a deputy with the Wood County Sheriff's Department. On 6/16/22, MLK states that she was in a vehicle with the defendant and defendant threatened to hit her and kill her.  She states that that happened on 6/14/22.  She states that she feared for her safety. He contacted defendant regarding the allegations.  He states that they were in an argument. Attorney Jakobson cross-examines witness.  Attorney Oswald redirects. Attorney Oswald asks Court take judicial notice of 21CF712, a case defendant was out on bond for. 
M.L.K. is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Jakobson. She testifies as to the events of 6/16/22 and the agreement that she and the defendant had. She didn't think defendant was threatening her.  
Attorney Oswald makes statement. 
Attorney Jakobson makes statement.  
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Not guilty plea. Bound over for further proceedings.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jesse L Hansen Schumann

Prior: 8097 Arpin Richfield Road, Arpin, WI 54410

Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on July 25, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Parties can attend counseling together. Parties can have telephone contact to arrange first appointment.
Parties can attend counseling together.  Parties can have telephone contact to arrange first appointment.

Victim, MLK, makes a statement to the Court to lift the no contact provision.  Attorney Oswald makes a statement opposing the modification.  

Court denies. Bond is amended that the parties can attend counseling together and may have telephone contact to arrange the first appointment.
